sys_script_include.description: This file simply tracks global update sets required for this application
sys_script_include.name: DeploymentNotes
sys_script_include.script:
/*
Version 1.0.3 ECM Global Update Set CTL081617 ECM_SLA_Repair_BusinessRule_v1_JWD
Version 1.0.4 Managed Documents Plug-in has been activated and is referenced on ECM Case
Version 1.0.7 ECM_DocumentValidation_ClientScript_v1_JWD ( no longer necessary past v1.0.8 ) global.US778318-History-TSF v1.0
Version 1.8.1 ** switched version convention to major.minor.fix ECM_DocumentValidation_ClientScript_v2_JWD : This negates earlier update set ECM_DocumentValidation_ClientScript_v1_JWD. It can be ignored if that update set was not applied. ECM_DOI_SLA_Calculator_v1_JWD : Supports State-level Regulatory SLA calculations
Version 1.9.0 ECM_SLA_Repair_BusinessRule_v2_JWD : No-op update set. Fixes missing file in upstream environment. May not be necessary for future deployments.
** NOTE : Calendar spans and children for the ECM Business Schedule were missing at this point and manually imported to TEST. Make sure these migrated correctly.
Version 1.9.4 ECM_SSN-List-Mask_v1_JWD : Adds global UI Script on load of page to mask SSN fields in the ECM Case list view. ECM_SSN-List-Mask_v2_JWD : bug fix for above, clearing console error Managed_Documents-Option-Fix_JWD_v1 : Fix for ServiceNow bug in Managed Documents type setting. *** Not ECM-related *** ECM Global Update Set CTL091117-1 : Adds new role to managed documents, list modification for dms_document, Lockdown of Create NEW button on managed documents, label override on task.due_date
Version 1.9.5 ECM_DOI_SLA_Calculator_v2_JWD : Bug fix for calendar-based DOI SLAs being a day late. ECM_DOI_SLA_Calculator_v3_JWD : Fixing North Carolina DOI SLAs being a day late.
Version 1.9.6 ECM_SLA_Repair_BusinessRule_v3_JWD : Business rules resetting ECM Quality Review SLAs on appropriate date changes.
Version 1.9.9 Update set named "ECM Global Update Set CTL112017-1" Update set contains; Created NEW UI Action named "Reject" with condition; current.source_table != 'kb_knowledge' && current.state == 'requested' && (gs.hasRole('admin')) && !isApprovalMine(current) Modified UI Action named "Reject" modified condition to be: current.source_table != 'kb_knowledge' && current.state == 'requested' && isApprovalMine(current)
Created NEW notification named "Optum Approval Request" with condition "Approval for.Task type is ECM Tasks" AND "Approval for.Short Description is NOT "Written Response Letter Review" " Created NEW Email Template named ecm.approve.role Created NEW Email Notification named "ECM Approval Request" Set baseline notification named "Approval Request" to not active
Set baseline WRITE ACL named "sysapproval_approver.state" active false Created two new WRITE ACLs named "sysapproval_approver.state One has condition of "Source table is x_opt_ecm_tasks" with script of "answer = (current.approver == gs.getUserID());" Second one replaces the baseline WRITE ACL with a condition of "Source table is x_opt_ecm_tasks" and Role of approval_admin.
Versions 2.x to 2.0.22 include multiple enhancements and fixes: Changes to required fields on case. Addition of fields such as phone number extensions and prompts. Inquiry complaint types require no fields on case. Add DMHC on submission source. Additional complaint types. Disabling 24 Hour callback notifications for groups. Adding executive summary required field with rules on making summary field required on resolve/close Several dot release versions are due to the publisher not behaving and prematurely ending, but advancing the version number - forcing another publish. 2.0.20 through 2.0.21 (and some prior versions) failed to push to repository. */
